Package iscteiul.ista

Class PropertySwapAdvisor

java.lang.Object
iscteiul.ista.PropertySwapAdvisor
public final class PropertySwapAdvisor extends Object

PropertySwapAdvisor

This utility class provides methods to generate potential swap suggestions among merged properties belonging to different owners. It evaluates:

  • Area similarity – If two properties have similar areas.
  • Distance to Funchal – Compares how close each property is to Funchal (Sé).
  • Distance to Machico – Compares how close each property is to Machico.

For each pair of adjacent properties (as defined by the merged property graph), if they have different owners and their area ratio is below a given threshold, the advisor computes an overall score that combines these three metrics with different weights:

  • Area similarity: 80%
  • Funchal distance similarity: 15%
  • Machico distance similarity: 5%

A higher score indicates a more promising swap, balancing the interest in minimal differences in area and in distances to major landmarks.

This class is final and has a private constructor to prevent instantiation, as it functions purely as a static utility.

  • Method Details

    • suggestSwaps

      public static List<SwapSuggestion> suggestSwaps(org.jgrapht.graph.SimpleGraph<PropertyRecord,org.jgrapht.graph.DefaultEdge> mergedGraph, double areaThreshold, int maxSuggestions)

      Suggests swaps between merged properties in the given graph. Each edge in mergedGraph represents two properties that are spatially adjacent (touching). We only consider a swap if the two properties belong to different owners and if their areas differ by at most areaThreshold in relative terms.

      The method then calculates three similarity measures:

      1. Area Similarity, in [0..1], defined as 1 - areaRatio.
      2. Funchal Distance Similarity, comparing how each property differs in distance to Funchal. If the geometry or reference is missing, the swap is skipped.
      3. Machico Distance Similarity, analogous to the Funchal approach.

      Finally, an overall score is computed as a weighted combination:

      score = 0.8 * areaSimilarity + 0.15 * funchalSimilarity + 0.05 * machicoSimilarity;

      Suggestions are returned in a list, sorted by descending score. If there are more than maxSuggestions possible swaps, only the top maxSuggestions are included.

      Parameters:
      mergedGraph - the adjacency graph (where each vertex is a merged property)
      areaThreshold - the maximum allowable relative area difference (e.g., 0.1 = 10%)
      maxSuggestions - the maximum number of suggestions to return
      Returns:
      a list of SwapSuggestion objects, sorted descending by score
      See Also:
      • SwapSuggestion
      • PropertyUtils.distanceToFunchal(int)
      • PropertyUtils.distanceToMachico(int)
